body.p:
Sept 29th 1863.
To the Governor of Kentucky, --

Mr F. Gorin will be indicted at the next term of our Criminal Court for willful shooting with intent to kill. I was shot by him and should he be convicted I hope he will be pardoned immediately. I have not spoken to Mr Gorin since the difficulty but believeing he was under the influence of liquor and also under the influence of great popular excitement caused by the raid of Genl Morgan together with remarks made by me in response to remarks he made to me I am satisfied he ought to be pardoned if convicted.
